adverbs.description: serendipitously (comparative more serendipitously, superlative most serendipitously)

entries.meaning: By serendipity; by blind luck in combination with wisdom; by fortunate accident.
examples: And that was a few years before the serendipitously named American politician Anthony Weiner reminded us once again that a high-powered job is no guarantee of knowing what to do with your penis, through his "sexting" use of Twitter (Snapchat hadn't been invented yet.)
